name: Illiteracy

description: Druidic avenger DRUIDIC AVENGER The druidic avenger channels her inner fury to wreak ven- geance upon those who injure the natural world. This comes at a price, however, since the avenger must give up some of her own sensitivity to nature.
name: DRUID VARIANT

description: Add Intimidate to the avenger’s list of class skills. Eliminate Diplomacy from the avenger’s list of class skills. Class Features The druidic avenger has all the standard druid class features, except as noted below.
name: Class Skills

description: An avenger does not gain the service of an animal companion. Fast Movement (Ex): A druidic avenger’s base land speed is faster than the norm for her race by 10 feet. This ability is identical to the barbarian ability of the same name. Rage (Ex): An avenger can enter a furious rage, identical to that of a barbarian. An avenger can use this ability once per day at 1st level, and one additional time per day for every fi ve levels above 1st. An avenger does not gain the greater rage, indomitable will, or mighty rage abilities.
name: Animal Companion

description: A druidic avenger takes a –4 penalty on wild empathy checks.
name: Wild Empathy

description: THUG The thug is a street fi ghter, a survivor who learns to mix brute force with a bit of craftiness. He has most of the fi ghter’s strengths, along with some additional skills to help keep him alive on the mean streets. Despite the name, not all thugs are mere hooligans—many are crafty veterans who use their knowledge of the streets to gain an advantage against their opponents. Most thugs are nonlawful, though sometimes gangs of thugs with a lawful streak band together.
name: FIGHTER VARIANT

description: Add the following skills to the fi ghter’s class skill list: Bluff, Gather Information, Knowledge (local), and Sleight of Hand. The thug gains skill points per level equal to 4 + Int modifi er (and has this number ×4 at 1st level). Class Features The thug has all the standard fi ghter class features, except as noted below.
name: Class Skills

description: A thug doesn’t gain the normal fi ghter bonus feat at 1st level. Also, add Urban Tracking (see the sidebar later in this chapter) to the list of fi ghter bonus feats available to the thug. Illus. by D. Crabapple 620_88156_UnearthedArcana2.indd 51 12/11/03, 9:12:19 AM 52 2 RETPAHC SESSALC
name: Bonus Feats

description: A paladin of tyranny must be of lawful evil track down a missing person, suspect, or other individual within alignment and loses all class abilities if he ever willingly commits a community. a good act. Additionally, a paladin of tyranny’s code requires that Wild Empathy: An urban ranger adds only one-half his class he respect authority fi gures as long as they have the strength to level to wild empathy checks, refl ecting his limited connection rule over the weak, act with discipline (not engaging in random with the natural world. slaughter, keeping fi rm control over those beneath his station, and so forth), help only those who help him maintain or improve his Urban status, and punish those who challenge authority (unless, of course, ranger such challengers prove more worthy to hold that authority).
name: Code of Conduct

description: While he may adventure with characters of any evil or neutral alignment, a paladin of tyranny will never know- ingly associate with good characters unless it serves his needs, nor will he continue an association with someone who consis- tently offends his moral code. A paladin of tyranny may accept henchmen and followers of any alignment, but may only accept cohorts who are lawful evil.
name: Associates

description: PLANAR RANGER The planar ranger roams the multiverse instead of the wilder- ness, learning the secrets of the elemental planes, the glorious Seven Heavens, and the horrible Abyss.
name: RANGER VARIANT

description: Eliminate Knowledge (nature) and Knowledge (dungeoneering) from the ranger’s class skill list. Add Knowledge (the planes) and Speak Language (Abyssal, Aquan, Auran, Celestial, Ignan, Infernal, Terran only) to the class skill list. Class Features The planar ranger has all the standard ranger class features, except as noted below.
name: ClassSkills

description: FRACTIONAL BASE BONUSES Fractional Base Save and Base Attack Bonuses The progressions of base attack bonuses and base save bo- Base Base Base Base Base nuses in the Player’s Handbook increase at a fractional rate, but Save Save Attack Attack Attack those fractions are eliminated due to rounding. For single-class Class Bonus Bonus Bonus Bonus Bonus characters, this rounding isn’t signifi cant, but for multiclass char- Level (Good) (Poor) (Good) (Average) (Poor) acters, this rounding often results in reduced base attack and 1st +2-1/2 +1/3 +1 +3/4 +1/2 base save bonuses. 2nd +3 +2/3 +2 +1-1/2 +1 For example, a 1st-level rogue/1st-level wizard has a base 3rd +3-1/2 +1 +3 +2-1/4 +1-1/2 attack bonus (BAB) of +0 from each class, resulting in a total 4th +4 +1-1/3 +4 +3 +2 BAB of +0. But that’s only due to the rounding of each fractional 5th +4-1/2 +1-2/3 +5 +3-3/4 +2-1/2 value down to 0 before adding them together—the character 6th +5 +2 +6 +4-1/2 +3 actually has BAB +3/4 from her rogue level and BAB +1/2 from 7th +5-1/2 +2-1/3 +7 +5-1/4 +3-1/2 her wizard level. If the rounding was done after adding together 8th +6 +2-2/3 +8 +6 +4 the fractional values, rather than before, the character would 9th +6-1/2 +3 +9 +6-3/4 +4-1/2 have BAB +1 (rounded down from 1-1/4). 10th +7 +3-1/3 +10 +7-1/2 +5 The table below presents fractional values for the base save 11th +7-1/2 +3-2/3 +11 +8-1/4 +5-1/2 and base attack bonuses presented in Table 3–1 in the Player’s 12th +8 +4 +12 +9 +6 Handbook. To determine the total base save bonus or base attack 13th +8-1/2 +4-1/3 +13 +9-3/4 +6-1/2 bonus of a multiclass character, add together the fractional values 14th +9 +4-2/3 +14 +10-1/2 +7 gained from each of her class levels. 15th +9-1/2 +5 +15 +11-1/4 +7-1/2 For space purposes, the table does not deal with the mul- 16th +10 +5-1/3 +16 +12 +8 tiple attacks gained by characters with a base attack bonus of 17th +10-1/2 +5-2/3 +17 +12-3/4 +8-1/2 +6 or greater. A second attack is gained when a character’s 18th +11 +6 +18 +13-1/2 +9 total BAB reaches +6, a third at +11, and a fourth at +16, just 19th +11-1/2 +6-1/3 +19 +14-1/4 +9-1/2 as normal. 20th +12 +6-2/3 +20 +15 +10 This variant is ideal for campaigns featuring many multiclass characters, since it results in their having slightly higher base ADDING FRACTIONS save and base attack bonuses than in a standard game. Adding together halves, quarters, and thirds can be tricky. Here’s For example, in a standard game, a 5th-level cleric/2nd-level a cheat sheet to help you with some of the common sums you fi ghter would have base save bonuses of Fort +7, Ref +1, Will +4. might encounter. In this variant, the same character would have Fort +7 (rounded 1/4 + 1/3 = 7/12 down from +7-1/2), Ref +2 (rounded down from +2-1/3), and 1/4 + 2/3 = 11/12 Will +5 (rounded down from +5-1/6). 1/2 + 1/3 = 10/12
